definition: to scrape/to blow/to shave/to plunder/to extort

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: It has saved my post-shave legs from irritation and allowed me to wear shorts all summer long.
sentences.chinese: 它救了我的後刮鬍子腿從刺激和允許我穿短褲夏天長。

sentences.english: His beard straggles because he hasn't shaven for a week.
sentences.chinese: 他的鬍鬚蓬亂，他有一個星期沒刮鬍子了。

sentences.english: Do you shave yourself or go to the barbers?
sentences.chinese: 你是自已刮鬍子，還是去理髮廳。

sentences.english: I’m often unshaven, dressed in sweats, slouched at my desk.
sentences.chinese: 我常常不刮鬍子，穿着汗衫，無精打采地坐在桌子上。

sentences.english: No more irritation shaving or post-shave.
sentences.chinese: 沒有更多的刺激或剃鬚後刮鬍子。

sentences.english: Aberdonian had received hairbrush, ask barber a moment ago shaved to him want how many money.
sentences.chinese: 有位蘇格蘭人上理髮店去修面刮鬍子。

sentences.english: SHAVE】Do you shave yourself or go to the barber's?
sentences.chinese: 你是自己刮鬍子還是去理髮廳？

sentences.english: Dad, what do you call that thingamajig you use to shave with ?
sentences.chinese: 爸爸，你用來刮鬍子的東西叫什麼？

sentences.english: I lathered my face and started to shave.
sentences.chinese: 他刮鬍子時把臉刮破了。

sentences.english: Allow baby to touch Daddy's face before he shaves.
sentences.chinese: 在爸爸刮鬍子前可以讓寶寶摸摸他的臉。

sentences.english: Have a look at your sink after you brush your teeth or shave.
sentences.chinese: 在刷牙或刮鬍子之後，看看您家的水槽。

sentences.english: I will never complain about nicking myself while shaving again.
sentences.chinese: 我不會再抱怨刮鬍子時把自己弄出傷口了。

sentences.english: Have Aberdonian on barber shop goes shave shaves.
sentences.chinese: 有位蘇格蘭人上理髮店去修面刮鬍子。

sentences.english: Allow baby to touch Daddy's face beforehe shaves.
sentences.chinese: 在爸爸刮鬍子前可以讓寶寶摸摸他的臉。

sentences.english: Doctor, please hurry. My son swallowed a razor-blade.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子吞了一個刮鬍子刀片。

definition: in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
to make a concession/to be accommodating
lit. a girl changes eighteen times between childhood and womanhood (idiom)/fig. a young woman is very different from the little girl she once was
to like looking attractive (usually of girls)/aestheticism
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
